	This annual report on Form 10-K contains certain forward-looking statements within the meaning of Section 27A of the Securities Act of 1933, as amended, and Section 21E of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended, and is subject to the safe harbor created by those sections.&#160; For more information, see &#8220;Part I. Item 1.&#160; Business &#8212; Cautionary Note Regarding Forward-Looking Statements.&#8221;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.2PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.2PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	As used in this report, the terms &#8220;Cogentix,&#8221;&#8220;Cogentix Medical,&#8221; the &#8220;Company,&#8221; &#8220;we,&#8221; &#8220;us,&#8221; &#8220;our&#8221; and similar references refer to Cogentix Medical, Inc. (formerly known as Vision-Sciences, Inc.) and our consolidated subsidiaries, and the term &#8220;common stock&#8221; refers to our common stock, par value $0.01 per share.&#160; References to &#8220;VSCI,&#8221; &#8220;Vision-Sciences&#8221; or &#8220;Vision&#8221; generally refer to Vision-Sciences, Inc. and its consolidated subsidiaries prior to the consummation of the merger of Uroplasty, Inc. with and into Vision&#8217;s wholly-owned merger subsidiary (&#8220;Merger Sub&#8221;) on March 31, 2015 (the &#8220;merger&#8221;), and sometimes also are used as references to our current, ongoing operations related to the historical VSCI that continue following the merger.&#160; References to &#8220;UPI&#8221; or &#8220;Uroplasty&#8221; generally refer to Uroplasty, Inc., and its consolidated subsidiaries prior to the consummation of the merger, and sometimes are also used as reference to our current ongoing operations related to the historical UPI that continue following the merger and sometimes also are used as reference to our current, ongoing operations related to the historical Uroplasty that continue following the merger.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.2PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.2PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	All share and per share amounts have been adjusted to reflect the one-for-five reverse split of Vision&#8217;s outstanding common stock effective on March 31, 2015 immediately prior to the effective time of the merger.&#160; All numbers and prices related to common shares and options of Uroplasty that predated the merger have been adjusted to reflect the exchange ratio of 3.6331 shares of our common stock for each share of Uroplasty common stock, as well as the above mentioned one-for-five reverse stock split, a combined impact of 0.72662 shares of our common stock for each Uroplasty share of common stock.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.1PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.1PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	This report contains the following trademarks, trade names and service marks of ours: PrimeSightTM, Vision-Sciences&#174;, EndoSheath&#174;, Slide-On&#174;, EndoWipe&#174;, The Vision System&#174;, and Urgent&#174; for our neuromodulation product, Macroplastique&#174;&#160; for our urological tissue bulking product, VOX&#174; for our otolaryngology tissue bulking products, PTQ&#174; for our colorectal tissue bulking product and Uroplasty&#174; for Uroplasty LLC, one of our subsidiaries.&#160; This report also contains trademarks, trade names and
</FONT>
	&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	service marks that are owned by other persons or entities.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.3PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.3PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	&#160;On December 10, 2015, we changed our fiscal year from a fiscal year ending on March 31 of each year to a fiscal year ending on December 31 of each year effective as of December 31, 2015. This action created a transition period of April 1, 2015 through December 31, 2015 (the &#8220;Transition Period&#8221;).&#160; Unless otherwise indicated herein, comparisons of fiscal year results in the &#8220;Management&#8217;s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations&#8221; portion of this Transition Report, and elsewhere herein, compare results for the nine-month transition period from April 1, 2015 through December 31, 2015 to the nine-month unaudited period from April 1, 2014 through December 31, 2014 and the 12-month period of the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015, 2014, and 2013, respectively, and accordingly are not comparing results for a comparable period of time.
</DIV>

	&#160;

<HR STYLE="HEIGHT: 2PX; WIDTH: 30%; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-LEFT: AUTO; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN-RIGHT: AUTO" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">

<EFX_PART_I>
<A NAME="FIS_PART_I"></A>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.2PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.1PT">
<A NAME="FORM10KT_HTM_PARTI">
<!--ANCHOR-->
</A>
	PART I
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<EFX_BUSINESS>
<A NAME="FIS_BUSINESS"></A>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="5CA03349253E4A399279622830305D48" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 1.1PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 70.9PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	ITEM 1.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<A NAME="FORM10KT_HTM_BUSINESS">
<!--ANCHOR-->
</A>
	BUSINESS
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.1PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.1PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	On December 21, 2014, Vision-Sciences entered into a merger agreement with Uroplasty, a publicly traded corporation.&#160; The merger agreement provided for the merger of Uroplasty with and into a newly created, wholly-owned merger subsidiary of Vision-Sciences (&#8220;Merger Sub&#8221;).&#160; Following the approval of the merger by Vision-Sciences&#8217; and Uroplasty&#8217;s stockholders on March 30, 2015 and pursuant to the terms of the merger agreement, on March 31, 2015, Uroplasty merged with and into Merger Sub, with the Merger Sub continuing as the surviving entity and a wholly-owned subsidiary of Vision-Sciences under the name, &#8220;Uroplasty, LLC.&#8221;&#160; Vision-Sciences changed its name to &#8220;Cogentix Medical, Inc.&#8221; immediately following the merger and our common stock now trades on the NASDAQ Capital Market under the new symbol &#8220;CGNT.&#8221;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.1PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL">
	1
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage5"></A>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEHEADER" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<A HREF="#FORM10KT_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.1PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.1PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	The merger was accounted for as a reverse acquisition due to a number of factors including the relative voting interests in the combined company of the former Vision-Sciences and Uroplasty stockholders following the merger.&#160; As a result, Uroplasty and its consolidated subsidiaries represent the accounting acquirer in the merger, and Vision-Sciences and its consolidated subsidiary represent the legal acquirer in the merger.&#160; Accordingly, while Vision-Sciences was the legal acquirer in the merger, Uroplasty is treated as the acquiring company in the merger for accounting purposes, and the merger has been accounted for as a reverse acquisition under the acquisition method of accounting for business combinations.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.1PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.1PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	As a result of the merger, our financial statements prior to March 31, 2015 are the historical financial statements of Uroplasty, and our financial statements on and after March 31, 2015 reflect the results of the operations of Uroplasty and Vision-Sciences on a consolidated basis. We refer you to Note 2 to the &#8220;Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements&#8221; in Part II, Item 8 of this report for additional description of this merger, the accounting treatment of the merger, and the pro forma financial information for Cogentix Medical on a combined basis.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.2PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.2PT">
	Overview of the Company
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.1PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.1PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Cogentix Medical is a global medical device company headquartered in Minnetonka, Minnesota, with additional operations in New York, Massachusetts, The Netherlands and the United Kingdom.&#160; We design, develop, manufacture and market a robust line of high performance fiberoptic and video endoscopy products under the PrimeSight
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	TM
</SUP>
	brand that are used across multiple surgical specialties in diagnostic and treatment procedures.&#160; We also offer the Urgent
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	PC Neuromodulation System, a device that delivers percutaneous tibial nerve stimulation (&#8220;PTNS&#8221;), for the office-based treatment of overactive bladder (&#8220;OAB&#8221;).&#160; OAB is a chronic condition that affects approximately 40 million adults in the U.S.&#160; The symptoms include urinary urgency, frequency and urge incontinence.&#160; We also offer Macroplastique
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	Implants, an injectable urethral bulking agent for the treatment of adult female stress urinary incontinence that is primarily due to intrinsic sphincter deficiency.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.1PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.1PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	The PrimeSight flexible endoscopes are used in conjunction with the proprietary sterile, single-use microbial barrier known as the EndoSheath
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	Protective Barrier. Because the EndoSheath barrier is placed over the patient contact area of the scope, it eliminates the need for high-level disinfection between cases.&#160; This allows a scope to be ready in substantially less time than with conventional reprocessing. Key advantages to the PrimeSight endoscopes when used with the EndoSheath protective barrier are reduction in costs and time associated with traditional reprocess, increased practice productivity and patient throughput. The PrimeSight endoscopy line also include rigid endoscopes and highly portable peripherals such as the video system and strobosopy unit.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.1PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.1PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	We target two primary market spaces for our PrimeSight Endoscopy line:
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<TABLE ID="085D8902D9844E66835897F9E7A1C506" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL, SERIF; WIDTH: 18PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Urology &#8211; we manufacture, market and sell our cystoscopy systems and EndoSheath protective barriers to urologists.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<TABLE ID="A94D4BE4BA55460FADA05F9E46FB240D" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL, SERIF; WIDTH: 18PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Airway Management &#8211; we manufacture, market, and sell our:&#160; (i) bronchoscopy systems (an endoscope that allows detailed viewing of the lungs) and EndoSheath protective barrier to intensivists, pulmonologists, thoracic surgeons, and other airway-related physicians,&#160; (ii) TNE (transnasal esophagoscopy) systems and EndoSheath protective barrier to general surgeons, primarily bariatric and gastroesophageal reflux disease (&#8220;GERD&#8221;) surgeons, and&#160; (iii) ENT (ear, nose and throat) endoscopy systems to ENT physicians and speech pathologists.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.1PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.1PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Our Urgent
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	PC Neuromodulation System (&#8220;Urgent PC System&#8221;) is a U.S. Food and Drug Administration (the &#8220;FDA&#8221;) cleared, minimally invasive nerve stimulation device designed for office-based treatment of OAB and the associated symptoms of urge incontinence, urinary urgency and urinary frequency.&#160; Using a small-gauge needle electrode inserted above the ankle, our Urgent PC System delivers electrical impulses to the tibial nerve that affects the sacral nerve plexus, a control center for pelvic floor and bladder function.&#160; Components of our Urgent PC System include a 34 gauge needle electrode, a lead set and an external, handheld, battery-powered stimulator.&#160; For each 30-minute office-based therapy session, the physician or other qualified health care provider inserts the needle electrode above the ankle and connects the electrode to the stimulator.&#160; Typically, a patient undergoes a course of 12 consecutive weekly treatments, and, subsequently, a personal treatment plan of single treatments at a lesser frequency to sustain the therapeutic effect.&#160; We believe physicians prefer our Urgent PC System because it offers effective therapies for patients that can be administered in an office setting and provides the physicians with a profitable revenue stream.&#160; We believe patients prefer the Urgent PC System to pharmaceutical treatment options or surgeries because it is a minimally invasive treatment alternative that does not have the side effects associated with pharmaceutical treatment options or the adverse events associated with surgeries.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.1PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL">
	2
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage6"></A>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEHEADER" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<A HREF="#FORM10KT_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Macroplastique
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	(&#8220;Macroplastique&#8221;) is an injectable, urethral bulking agent for the treatment of adult female stress urinary incontinence primarily resulting from intrinsic sphincter deficiency.&#160; It is designed to restore the patient&#8217;s urinary continence immediately following treatment.&#160; Macroplastique is a soft-textured, permanent implant injected, under endoscopic visualization, around the urethra distal to the bladder neck.&#160; It is a proprietary composition of heat vulcanized, solid, soft, irregularly shaped polydimethylsiloxane (solid silicone elastomer) implants suspended in a biocompatible excretable carrier gel.&#160; We believe our compound is better than other commercially available bulking agents because, with its unique composition, shape and size, it does not degrade, is not absorbed into surrounding tissues and does not migrate from the implant site.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.2PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.2PT">
	Overview of Strategy for Calendar Year 2016 and Beyond
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.1PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.1PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Our strategy for 2016 and beyond is to continue to leverage our assets to generate organic growth and to expand our product portfolio.&#160; We currently have a distribution platform that includes 48 direct sales representatives in the U.S., with 41 sales representatives serving the Urology market and 7 sales representatives serving the Airway Management and Other markets.&#160; Internationally, we have 8 direct sales representatives in certain geographies and a network of distributor relationships.&#160; We believe this sales force has the capacity to add more products to their existing portfolio, and a key element of our strategy is to continue to leverage this distribution platform to generate revenue growth.&#160; We plan to expand our product portfolio through merger, acquisition, licensing or distribution opportunities.&#160; We believe that there are underperforming yet innovative assets available that we can add to our portfolio and grow at double digit rates.&#160; Examples of such assets include orphaned technologies within larger organizations, new technologies ready for commercialization with which our existing distribution platform can penetrate the market quickly, and existing products that are not meeting their potential due to undersized sales forces within their current company.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.2PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.2PT">
	Products and Markets
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.1PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.1PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	We produce and market the following products:
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<TABLE ID="C530EE079FB54C9DA28A39C4F38A3392" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">

<TR>
